summary: This is an email chain from August 12, 2019, requesting assistance from personnel to escort someone to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) to monitor video downloading related to the Epstein matter. It also references interviews of BOP employees regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: All
persons.context: The email is addressed to 'All' as a group, requesting assistance with escorting someone to MCC and conducting interviews of BOP employees regarding the Epstein matter.

events.title: Video download monitoring at MCC
events.description: Request for someone to escort an individual to the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 8:30am to monitor the downloading of video.

events.title: Interviews of BOP employees
events.description: Conducting interviews of Bureau of Prisons employees regarding the Epstein matter.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 12, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
There is a request for assistance to escort someone to MCC to monitor the downloading of video, indicating investigative activity related to Epstein's incarceration.
Interviews of Bureau of Prisons employees were being conducted regarding the Epstein matter, suggesting an internal review or investigation.
The email shows coordination among personnel to handle tasks related to the Epstein case post-death.
The document reflects ongoing investigative efforts immediately following Epstein's death.
